name: interpretive-orchestration
description: Atelier of Co-Apprenticeship for interpretive qualitative research. Human and AI learn together as apprentices to the craft tradition (rigor, reflexivity, theoretical sensitivity). Three stages: Solo Practice → Side-by-Side Collaboration → Dialogue with Tradition. Prevents calculator mindset, embeds meta-cognition, maintains human interpretive authority.

author.name: Xule Lin and Kevin Corley (Imperial College London)
